snippet: The disease, rhizomelic chondrodysplasia punctata, is a painful form of dwarfism, usually accompanied by intellectual disability and respiratory ills.
abstract: Canadian biotech company Phenomenome Discoveries may have discovered treatment for rhizomelic chondrodysplasia punctata, extremely rare, uncurable and usually fatal form of dwarfism; set of synthetic compounds could raise plasmalogen levels, possibly extending lives of children born with disease; families of such children around world, who connect through support group and annual conference, try to temper new hopes with realistic expectations.
lead_paragraph: The disease, rhizomelic chondrodysplasia punctata, is a painful form of dwarfism, usually accompanied by intellectual disability and respiratory ills.

headline.main: Flicker of Hope for Children With Rare and Devastating Disease
headline.print_headline: Flicker of Hope for Rare Disease
